subject: Re: Reply required urgently in creating HTML reports
msgSnippet: I have exactly the same problem. I have a bunch of TEST-*.txt file that the junitreport does not see. Because of that, it generates an empty report.  Did you
messageBody:
I have exactly the same problem. I have a bunch of TEST-*.txt file
that the junitreport does not see. Because of that, it generates an
empty report. Did you find a solution??



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "poojar2710" <poojar2710@y...> wrote:
>
> My class file is at C:/ISMC and the tests are running also as the
> XML file "TEST-Simple.xml" is generated properly with the required
> output but "TESTS-TestSuites.xml" is not having any details of the
> test run. It has just two lines:
> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
> <testsuites></testsuites>
>
> This shows that the above XML file(TESTS-TestSuites.xml) is not able
> to collect data from individual tests' XML file. And I'm not able to
> figure out the possible reason for this. Could you help me in this.
>
> Thanks & Regards,
> Pooja
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@p...>
> wrote:
> > I think your tests aren't running at all, which explains
> > why your XML files are empty. Is your class file really
> > in C:/ISMC and not something like C:/ISMC/build/tests?
> >
> > You might need to change
> > <include name="Simple.class" />
> >
> > to
> > <include name="**/*Simple.class" />
> >
> >
> > Todd.
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> > > Behalf Of poojar2710
> > > Sent: Tuesday, August 30, 2005 12:57 AM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: [junit] Reply required urgently in creating HTML reports
> > >
> > > Hello,
> > > Could anyone please help me in creating HTML reports using
> > > ANT task with JUNIT.
> > >
> > > I ran the below xml file using ANT but the HTML reports
> > > generated doesn't show any details of the test run though the
> > > XML file "Test- Classname.xml" shows complete details.
> > >
> > > <project basedir="C:/ISMC" default="Simple-html" > <property
> > > name="test.reports" value="C:/ISMC/Reports" /> <property
> > > name="test.class.name" value="Simple" />
> > >
> > > <path id="test.classpath">
> > > <pathelement location="C:/ISMC" />
> > > <pathelement location="C:/ISMC/junit3" />
> > > <pathelement location="C:/jdk1.4/bin" />
> > > <pathelement location="C:/jdk1.4/lib" /> </path>
> > >
> > > <target name="Simple-html">
> > > <junit fork="yes" printsummary="no" haltonfailure="no">
> > > <batchtest fork="yes" todir="${test.reports}" >
> > > <fileset dir="C:/ISMC">
> > > <include name="Simple.class" />
> > > </fileset>
> > > </batchtest>
> > > <formatter type="xml" />
> > > <classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
> > > </junit>
> > >
> > > <junitreport todir="${test.reports}">
> > > <fileset dir="${test.reports}">
> > > <include name="Test-*.xml" />
> > > </fileset>
> > > <report todir="${test.reports}" />
> > > </junitreport>
> > > </target>
> > > </project>
> > >
> > > Also the TESTS-TestSuites.xml file just shows the below two
> lines :
> > > <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
> > > <testsuites></testsuites>
> > >
> > > Regards,
> > > Pooja
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
